pullRequest.body:
These replacements have been performed completely mechanically by a script and, in the branch with the script, have passed CI with no extra input (except fixing a long line and one indentation issue).

The script exclusively removes `'` from `refine'` and add `?` in front of `_` as appropriate.

Assuming that I did not leave out any cases, the only `refine'`s that could still be replaced by a simple-minded translation `refine' ...` to ``refine [sprinkle some `?`]`` are the 52 that involve at least 5 holes.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/370cba9f-e450-4235-beeb-7f9af952bb70) for commit e055244883dbd261f6a8e075d4497737d2013101.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a249584b-26e9-498b-b22f-882d5fa2a825/to/370cba9f-e450-4235-beeb-7f9af952bb70) against commit 36a9da67e9f7d861837f652aba6820e33328a0df:
```diff
  Benchmark                       Metric         Change
  =====================================================
+ ~Mathlib.SetTheory.Game.Short   instructions   -58.7%
```
You have a merge conflict... I think we should merge this asap
Riccardo, with the last commit, I should have fixed the merge conflict.
Does this include the modifications in #13287?
No, the two PRs touch independent files (or, if they touch the same file, it is a coincidence).
OK, let's start with merging the other one.
Sure, I am waiting for CI to finish and for the `merge-conflict` label to be removed (I fixed the conflict locally).
There were conflicts, but I resolved them all locally and I just pushed the resolved branch.

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9303330053/job/25605389355)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9303330053/job/25605389660)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9303330053/job/25605389115)
I still count more than 600 `refine'`. Do you have plans to remove those too?
In branch `RB/refine` I removed a couple of those, that didn't create any problem. I can of course keep going, but maybe it is worth to understand why your script didn't catch them.

I think it would be a good idea to replace the `refine`s with `exact`s where possible. (I can help with that if needed). Also, a `refine` within a `refine` seems like code smell (which is another issue entirely 😅 )

Replacing terminal `refine`s with `exact` turned out to result in slowing mathlib.  There is a PR somewhere with timings and all.

Nested `refine`s: I agree, but I think that it is a separate issue to replacing `refine'` with `refine`.
I think both issues can be deal with in separate PRs.

For completeness, #11890 is the PR that systematically replaced every terminal `refine` with `exact`.  You can see there that the modification made mathlib slower overall.  I then selected the files that were *improved* by the modification and PRed those alone.

So, unless there is the desire for a further "terminal `refine` audit", I would be skeptical of mass-replacing finishing `refine`s by `exact`.
Interesting. I would not have expected `exact` to be slower than `refine`.
I was also surprised by this, but luckily the PR was benchmarked before deciding to merge!
Is there a reason why the script is sometimes adding empty lines to the end of files ?

I am glad that you asked!  I noticed that an earlier version of the script was careless with ending character, so I fixed it (I think), but some of the earlier modifications were not modified again by the updated script.

I'll fix the endings of the files.

Done!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: final batch of mass replacements `refine'` to `refine`
